thread.title: Briefs: UNH's Lightfoot receives America East honor
thread.title_full: Briefs: UNH's Lightfoot receives America East honor

title: Briefs: UNH's Lightfoot receives America East honor
text: Briefs: UNH's Lightfoot receives America East honor fosters.com Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 3:15 AM Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 3:15 AM BOSTON — Senior Madison Lightfoot of the University of New Hampshire volleyball team was named the defensive specialist of the week by the America East. The co-captain recorded 37 digs over two matches, averaging 5.29 digs per set. She tallied 16 digs in the win over the Retrievers and shoveled out 21 attacks in the sweep over the Seawolves. Lightfoot helped backbone the UNH defense, limiting its opponents to an .123 attack percentage on the week. Individually, Lightfoot is third in America East in digs per set (4.24) and second in league tilts (4.68). Her presence in the backcourt has powered UNH's conference-best .172 opponent hitting percentage this season. The senior is the program's all-time leader in digs, scooping up 1,524 digs in her career as a Wildcat. Field Hockey NHIAA playoffs start this week DOVER — The NHIAA Division II field hockey playoffs start Wednesday with first-round action at the home of the higher seed. Two local teams play each other that day at 3 p.m.: No. 9 St. Thomas Aquinas (4-7-3) at No. 8 Kingswood (6-7-1). The winner advances to the quarters Saturday at No. 1 Lebanon (13-1-0). No. 3 Portsmouth (11-2-1) earned a bye and will host the Derryfield/Hanover winner Saturday in the quarters at 2 p.m. Cancer Awareness Pink the Wave Friday night DOVER — The Dover High School Green Wave Football Boosters Club, in cooperation with Dover High School Band and Cheering Booster Clubs, will host Pink the Wave Night this Friday, an annual fundraiser and breast cancer awareness event. During the 7 p.m. home football game against Pinkerton Academy, the Green Wave will turn pink with decorations and adornments to celebrate October’s breast cancer awareness month. Fondly called Pink the Wave Night, Dover and Pinkerton Academy High School players, fans, coaches and referees are encouraged to wear pink--the longtime symbol of breast cancer awareness. All proceeds raised during DHS’s Pink the Wave Night will go directly to evening benefactor, My Breast Cancer Support, a local non profit helping seacoast area breast cancer patients. The organization will have representatives on hand to share information on its support services. — Staff Reports ALCS Jays hold on to beat Royals TORONTO — Troy Tulowitzki and Josh Donaldson each homered in a six-run third inning, and Toronto's bats broke out at home for an 11-8 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Monday night that trimmed the Blue Jays' deficit to 2-1 in the AL Championship Series. Ryan Goins also connected and had a two-run single, one game after his misplayed pop fly set off Kansas City's winning rally Sunday. Veteran knuckleballer R.A. Dickey will try to get the Blue Jays even in the best-of-seven series Tuesday afternoon. He faces Kansas City's 6-foot-10 right-hander Chris Young in Game 4. — The Associated Press
